    • Method Detail

      • getGoal

        public Task getGoal()
        Returns:
        the task which this plan is supposed to achieve

      • getType

        public TaskClass getType()
        Returns:
        the task class of this plan's goal

      • getNotes

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> getNotes()
        Return list of notes to be added to verbose printing of this plan. This is convenience feature for applications to manage by side effect.
        See Also:
        print(PrintStream)

      • setOptionalStep

        public void setOptionalStep(boolean optionalStep)
        Makes this plan an optional step. Useful for procedural decompositions.

      • isOptionalStep

        public boolean isOptionalStep()
        Test whether this plan corresponds to an optional step of a decomposition.

      • isOptional

        public boolean isOptional()
        Test whether this plan is optional. It is optional iff it has not been accepted or started and it is either an optional step (see isOptionalStep()) with a non-true precondition or its parent is optional.

      • setRepeatStep

        public void setRepeatStep(int repeatStep)
        Makes this plan the nth repeated step (maxOccurs > 1). Useful for procedural decompositions.

      • getRepeatStep

        public int getRepeatStep()

      • isRepeatStep

        public boolean isRepeatStep()
        Test whether this plan corresponds to a repeated step of a decomposition.

      • getParent

        public Plan getParent()

      • isAncestor

        public boolean isAncestor(Plan plan)
        Test whether given plan can be reached from this plan by following parents. Note plan is not its own ancestor.

      • getAncestor

        public Plan getAncestor(TaskClass task)
        Return closest ancestor of this plan that has goal of given task class, or null if none.
        See Also:
        isAncestor(Plan)

      • isDescendant

        public boolean isDescendant(Plan plan)
        Test whether given plan can be reached from this plan by following children. Note plan is not its own descendant.

      • pathToDescendant

        public java.util.Stack<Plan> pathToDescendant(Plan plan)
        Return path from this plan to given plan iff it is a descendant; otherwise null. Path does not include this plan or descendant and thus will be empty if given plan is child.

      • getChildren

        public java.util.List<Plan> getChildren()
        Returns:
        unmodifiable list of children of this plan.

      • add

        public void add(Plan plan)
        Add given plan as child of this plan.

      • remove

        public void remove(Plan child)
        Remove given child of this plan.
        Parameters:
        child - - must be child of this plan

      • requires

        public void requires(Plan plan)

      • isRequired

        public boolean isRequired(Plan plan)

      • getSuccessors

        public java.util.List<Plan> getSuccessors()
        Return unmodifiable list of immediate successors of this plan, i.e., the plans that require it.

      • getPredecessors

        public java.util.List<Plan> getPredecessors()
        Return unmodifiable list of immediate predecessors of this plan, i.e., the plans it requires.

      • execute

        public void execute()
        System executes script for goal of this plan.

      • occurred

        public boolean occurred()

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone()
        Tests whether plans which require this plan should become live. Note that this plan may have "trailing" optional steps that have not yet been completed.
        See Also:
        isExhausted()

      • isFailed

        public boolean isFailed()

      • isSuccess

        public boolean isSuccess()

      • isApplicable

        public java.lang.Boolean isApplicable()

      • isAchieved

        public java.lang.Boolean isAchieved()

      • isLive

        public boolean isLive()

      • isPoppable

        public boolean isPoppable()
        Tests whether popping plan from the stack would constitute an unnecessary focus shift.
        Returns:
        true iff popping would not be an unnecessary focus shift.

      • setComplete

        public void setComplete(boolean complete)
        Useful for setting a non-primitive complete when there is no decomposition.

      • isComplete

        public boolean isComplete()
        Tests whether all the non-optional steps of this plan are done. Note that even if this method returns true (and this plan is therefore done), it may still have optional ("trailing") children that are live. Returns false for primitive tasks.
        See Also:
        isDecomposed(), isDone(), isPassed(), setComplete(boolean)

      • isPassed

        public boolean isPassed()

      • isBlocked

        public boolean isBlocked()

      • getLive

        public java.util.List<Plan> getLive()
        Return list of live children of this plan.
        See Also:
        getLiveDescendants()

      • getLiveDescendants

        public java.util.List<Plan> getLiveDescendants()
        Return list of live descendants of this plan. Note that a non-live (done) plan may have live descendants due to trailing optional steps.
        See Also:
        hasLiveDescendants(), getLive()

      • hasLiveDescendants

        public boolean hasLiveDescendants()
        Test whether this plan has any live descendants. Note that a non-live (done) plan may have live descendants due to trailing optional steps.
        See Also:
        getLiveDescendants()

      • hasLiveSuccessor

        public boolean hasLiveSuccessor()
        Tests whether this plan has any live successors.

      • hasFailed

        public boolean hasFailed()
        Test whether this plan has any failed contributing children.

      • setStarted

        public void setStarted(boolean started)
        Useful for setting a non-primitive started when there is no decomposition.

      • isStarted

        public boolean isStarted()
        Test whether this plan or any of its descendants which is a starter Task.isStarter(Plan) for this plan.

      • isPrimitive

        public boolean isPrimitive()
        Test whether goal of this plan is instance of primitive type.

      • isInternal

        public boolean isInternal()
        Test whether goal of this plan is instance of internal type.

      • isExhausted

        public boolean isExhausted()
        Test whether this plan has any remaining steps that could be executed now. Returns true for non-live primitive task.
        See Also:
        isDone()

      • isMoot

        public boolean isMoot()
        Tests whether this plan is incomplete, but does not need to be executed because all the reasons for doing it have already been achieved or are no longer desired. Currently, this means that there is an achieved or occurred plan looking "up" from this plan.

      • isExpected

        public boolean isExpected()
        Tests whether this plan is or is expected to ever become live. For example, a plan which has been passed (required successor started) can never become live. Used mainly for status.

      • hasExpected

        public boolean hasExpected()
        Test whether this plan has immediate subplan which is expected.
        See Also:
        isExpected()

      • getExpected

        public java.util.List<Plan> getExpected()

      • match

        public void match(Task task)
        Identify given task as matching this plan and copy slot values. If given task is occurrence, then also check for failure (false postcondition) in ancestor plans.

      • fail

        public void fail()
        Indicate that this plan (including current decomposition, if any) has failed. Note that plan is not automatically retried by this call.
        See Also:
        retry()

      • retry

        public Plan retry()
        Retry this failed plan if it has any untried decompositions, or else recurse up through failed parents. Returns the retried plan or null if none.

      • getRetryOf

        public Plan getRetryOf()

      • getDecompositions

        public java.util.List<DecompositionClass> getDecompositions()
        Returns list of decompositions classes applicable to this plan, excluding any that have been tried and failed. If a decomposition class has been chosen, then this method returns a singleton list of that decomposition class.
        See Also:
        Task.getDecompositions(), TaskClass.getDecompositions()

      • getDecompositionClass

        public DecompositionClass getDecompositionClass()
        Returns the decomposition class, if any, chosen for this plan. Note that even if this method returns non-null, isDecomposed() may return false, which means that decomposition has not yet been applied.

      • setDecompositionClass

        public void setDecompositionClass(DecompositionClass decompClass)
        Set the decomposition class to use for this plan (replacing the current choice, if any). Note that isDecomposed() may return false after this method is called (because decomposition has not yet been applied). Also note that changing the decomposition class of an already started plan is not currently supported.

      • getDecomposition

        public Decomposition getDecomposition()
        Returns the decomposition instance, if any, used to decompose this plan. If this method returns non-null, then getDecompositionClass() returns the type of this instance. Warning: Calling this method will cause the currently chosen decomposition class to be applied, if it has not already been, which modifies the children of this plan. This can cause a ConcurrentModificationException if this method is called inside a getChildren() iterator.
        See Also:
        isDecomposed()

      • setDecomposition

        public void setDecomposition(Decomposition decomp)
        Apply the given decomposition to this plan (replacing the current decomposition, if any). Note that changing the decomposition of an already started plan is not currently supported.
        See Also:
        apply(DecompositionClass)

      • apply

        public Decomposition apply(DecompositionClass type)
        Decompose this plan using given decomposition class (assuming applicability condition already checked).
        Returns:
        resulting decomposition instance or null if application failed due to contradiction in bindings

      • setPlanned

        public void setPlanned(boolean planned)
        Mark (or unmark) the current children of this plan as a decomposition even if no decomposition class has been used.
        See Also:
        isDecomposed()

      • isPlanned

        public boolean isPlanned()
        Test whether this plan has been procedurally decomposed. Returns false for primitive task.
        See Also:
        isDecomposed()

      • isDecomposed

        public boolean isDecomposed()
        Tests whether the children of this plan are expected to achieve the goal (never true for a primitive task). Note that even if this method returns true, getDecompositionClass() may return null (because decomposition was done procedurally). Returns false for primitive tasks.
        See Also:
        setPlanned(boolean)

      • isHow

        public boolean isHow()
        Tests whether decomposition chosen for this plan. Returns true iff either isDecomposed() or getDecompositionClass() returns non-null. Returns false for primitive tasks.

      • decomposeAll

        public boolean decomposeAll()
        Recursively apply all decompositions that do not involve choices. Does not decompose done plans.
        Returns:
        true iff any decompositions applied

      • explain

        public java.util.List<Plan> explain(Task task,
                           boolean onlyLive,
                           Plan exclude)
        Return (possibly empty) list of plans in this plan tree which explain given task (i.e., to which given task contributes). Note immediate children of root node are always searched, even if onlyLive is true and root tree is done (not live), in order to match trailing optional steps in current focus. Otherwise, the search does not look below non-live nodes when onyLive is true.
        Parameters:
        onlyLive - only return live plans
        exclude - already searched (ignored if root)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • print

        public void print()

      • print

        public void print(java.io.PrintStream stream)
        Print a compact human-readable version of plan tree with this plan as root.
        See Also:
        getNotes()

      • print

        public void print(java.io.PrintStream stream,
         int indent,
         boolean recurse,
         boolean format,
         java.lang.String formatted)
